intro: Eritrichium torreyi, commonly known as the Sierra Bluecup, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its delicate, blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine and subalpine regions. It has small, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Eritrichium torreyi is often found in open, sunny habitats and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
